```{r}

library(tidyverse)
library(dplyr)

pilot_b_raw <- read_csv("/Users/alexpereira/Library/CloudStorage/OneDrive-Personal/Academics/Stanford/Courses/Fall_2023/PSYCH_251/paxton2012_rescue/data/pilot_b_data.csv")

# Replace c("column_name1", "column_name2") with the names of the columns you want to delete
columns_to_delete <- c("IPAddress", "ResponseId", "RecipientLastName", "RecipientFirstName", "RecipientEmail", "ExternalReference", "LocationLatitude", "LocationLongitude", "DistributionChannel", "Q_RecaptchaScore")

# Use tidyverse functions to remove specified columns
pilot_b_anon <- pilot_b_raw %>%
  select(-any_of(columns_to_delete))

view(pilot_b_anon)

# Export as CSV File
write.csv(pilot_b_anon, file = "/Users/alexpereira/Library/CloudStorage/OneDrive-Personal/Academics/Stanford/Courses/Fall_2023/PSYCH_251/paxton2012_rescue/data/pilot_b_anon.csv", row.names = FALSE)


```
